name: Crispy Mac & Cheese Balls
description: Fried Mac & Cheese Balls with Melted Cheese Center
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil; add macaroni and cook until tender but still holding shape; drain and set aside
In a large pot over medium heat, melt the butter
Add flour and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly
Stir in salt, black pepper, smoked paprika, and garlic powder
Slowly whisk in milk and heavy cream
Continue whisking until the sauce thickens slightly
Remove from heat and add cheddar, mozzarella, and gouda in three additions, stirring until fully melted and smooth
Add cooked macaroni to the cheese sauce and mix well
Spread mixture into a dish and refrigerate for 3–4 hours until very firm
Scoop 1–2 tablespoons of chilled mac and cheese, press a cube of cheese into the center, and roll into a tight ball
Roll each ball in flour, dip in beaten eggs, then coat with breadcrumbs
Fry balls in batches for 2–3 minutes until golden brown
Drain on paper towels and serve hot
